description:
UMD 3.13.0 is the fourteenth update, a minor update, of the third Major release of UMD 
(Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production 
infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5
 and 6.
releaseNotes: This release contains the following products. <br><br><h2>Compute Capabilities, Job Execution Capability, Parallel Job Capability</h2><br><h3>CREAM 1.16.5 (SL6 only)</h3><br>This version of CREAM fixes several bugs, see <a href="http://www.eu-emi.eu/releases/emi-3-monte-bianco/updates/-/asset_publisher/5Na8/content/update-24-16-02-2015-v-3-15-0-1#CREAM_v_1_16_5">http://www.eu-emi.eu/releases/emi-3-monte-bianco/updates/-/asset_publisher/5Na8/content/update-24-16-02-2015-v-3-15-0-1#CREAM_v_1_16_5</a> for more details.<br><br><h2>Accounting Capability, Operations Capabilities</h2><br><h3>APEL 1.4.1</h3>Added ability to process files compressed with bzip2. Added multiplier retrieval to GridEngine parser for CPU and wall-clock time. Fixed integer overflow when loading normalised summaries into APEL servers. Corrected the way some logging calls were made and reduced the logging level when trying to purge a directory that isn't empty. Changed server authorization system to keep the list of DNs for a limited time if unable to update from GOCDB and updated GOCDB query URL. Added Month and Year columns to primary key of CloudSummaries table in cloud schema. <br><br>See <a href="https://github.com/apel/apel/blob/1.4.0-1/CHANGELOG">https://github.com/apel/apel/blob/1.4.0-1/CHANGELOG</a> for more.<br><br><h2>Client Capabilities, Client Tools Capability</h2><br><h3>srm-ifce 1.22.1</h3>This update for SRM-IFCE contains one improvement and some bug fixes. Please have a look at <a href="http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/srm-ifce-1.22.1">http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/srm-ifce-1.22.1</a> for further details.<br><br><h2>Authentication Capability, Authorization Capability, Security Capabilities</h2><br><h3>gLExec 1.2.3</h3>This release of gLEXEC contains lcmaps-plugins-c-pep 1.3.0-1, with the following improvements: <br><br>implement support for multiple endpoints (either round-robin, round-robin with random startpoint or fully random)<br>number of improvements in the logging<br>check for unhandled obligations in the response. *A full list of changes can be found in the NEWS file in the package<br><br>Please refer to <a href="http://www.eu-emi.eu/releases/emi-3-monte-bianco/updates/-/asset_publisher/5Na8/content/update-25-09-03-2015-v-3-15-1-1#gLExec_wn_v_1_2_3">http://www.eu-emi.eu/releases/emi-3-monte-bianco/updates/-/asset_publisher/5Na8/content/update-25-09-03-2015-v-3-15-1-1#gLExec_wn_v_1_2_3</a> for a complete reference.<br><br><h2>File Access Capability, File Transfer Capability, Storage Capabilities, Storage Management Capability</h2><br><h3>StoRM server 1.11.8</h3>This release fixes a critical issue that prevented the proper cleanup of PtP requests state after an srmRm was called on a SURL. As a consequence, a SURL could remain stuck and it would be impossible to perform other PtPs on that SURL without cleaning the database state by hand. All sites should upgrade to 1.11.8 at their earliest convenience to avoid being affected by this issue.<br><br>This release also provides other fixes and improvements as can be seen from the individual components release notes. Please refer to <a href="http://italiangrid.github.io/storm/release-notes/StoRM-v1.11.8.html">http://italiangrid.github.io/storm/release-notes/StoRM-v1.11.8.html</a> for further details.<br><br><h3>dpm-xroot 3.5.2</h3>Please refer to <a href="https://svnweb.cern.ch/trac/lcgdm/wiki/Dpm/Xroot/vomsxrd">https://svnweb.cern.ch/trac/lcgdm/wiki/Dpm/Xroot/vomsxrd</a> for further details.<br><br><h3>XRootD 4.1.1</h3>The complete list of the improvements and bug fixes can be read at the following link: <a href="http://xrootd.org/download/ReleaseNotes.html">http://xrootd.org/download/ReleaseNotes.html</a><br><br><h3>CVMFS 2.1.20 </h3>Version 2.1.20 contains a number of new features and several bugfixes. Please refer to <a href="http://cernvm.cern.ch/portal/filesystem/cvmfs-2.1.20">http://cernvm.cern.ch/portal/filesystem/cvmfs-2.1.20</a> for further details.<br><br><h3>Frontier Squid 2.7.24 </h3>Please refer to <a href="http://frontier.cern.ch/dist/rpms-debug/frontier-squidRELEASE_NOTES">http://frontier.cern.ch/dist/rpms-debug/frontier-squidRELEASE_NOTES</a> for details on the new version of Frontier Squid.<br><br><h2>cas, Miscellaneous</h2><br><h3>fetch-crl 3.0.16 </h3>Several important fixes are available with this fetch-crl update, information available at <a href="https://dist.eugridpma.info/distribution/util/fetch-crl/CHANGES">https://dist.eugridpma.info/distribution/util/fetch-crl/CHANGES</a><br><br><h3>GFAL 2.8.4</h3>This release fixes several bugs, please see <a href="http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/gfal2-2.8.4">http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/gfal2-2.8.4</a> for details.<br><br><h3>GFAL2-PYTHON 1.7.1</h3>Please have a look at <a href="http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/gfal2-python-1.7.1">http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/gfal2-python-1.7.1</a> for details on the new version of this package.
installationNotes:
All products in the UMD 3.13.0 release were verified against EGI's 
current&nbsp; Quality Criteria (for further information, please see the 
documentation links) to support Scientific Linux 5 and Scientific
 Linux 6 (x86_64 processor architecture).&nbsp; Installation and configuration 
notes are available in the <a href="http://repository.egi.eu/category/umd_releases/distribution/umd-3/">EGI repository</a>.<a href="http://repository.egi.eu/category/umd_releases/distribution/umd-3/"></a>
contact: For further information about the UMD, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: cto (at) egi.eu.
technicalContact: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this UMD release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the <a href="https://ggus.eu/">EGI Helpdesk </a>to make a report.
knownIssues: Details containing known issues and workarounds found in EGI verification and <br>staged rollout are collected in:<br><a href="http://https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-3:UMD-3.12.0">https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-3:UMD-3.13.0</a>
changeLog: This release includes updates for the following products: <br><br><ul><li>CREAM 1.16.5 (SL6 only)</li><li>APEL 1.4.1</li><li>srm-ifce 1.22.1</li><li>GFAL 2.8.4</li><li>GFAL2-PYTHON 1.7.1</li><li>gLExec 1.2.3</li><li>StoRM server 1.11.8</li><li>dpm-xroot 3.5.2</li><li>XRootD 4.2.0</li><li>CVMFS 2.1.20 </li><li>Frontier Squid 2.7.24 </li><li>fetch-crl 3.0.16 </li></ul>

products.name: apel.apel
products.releaseNotes:
Added ability to process files compressed with bzip2.
Added multiplier retrieval to GridEngine parser for CPU and wall-clock time.
Fixed integer overflow when loading normalised summaries into APEL servers.
Corrected the way some logging calls were made and reduced the logging level when trying to purge a directory that isn't empty.
Changed server authorization system to keep the list of DNs for a limited time if unable to update from GOCDB and updated GOCDB query URL.
Added Month and Year columns to primary key of CloudSummaries table in cloud schema.

products.name: cernfrontier.squid
products.description: The Frontier distributed database caching system uses a RESTful http-based protocol to distribute data queries. The LHC experiments ATLAS and CMS use it to access conditions data describing their complicated detectors, and cache the results at all the worldwide sites that process their particle collision data. This twiki site contains documentation for the software of the Frontier system that is not experiment-specific.

products.name: cernvm.cvmfs
products.description: CernVM File System (CernVM-FS) is a network file system based on HTTP and optimized to deliver experiment software in a fast, scalable, and reliable way. Files and file metadata are aggressively cached and downloaded on demand. Thereby the CernVM-FS decouples the life cycle management of the application software releases from the operating system. CernVM-FS is included in CernVM, however it can also be used outside CernVM.

products.name: emi.cream
products.description: The CREAM (Computing Resource Execution And Management) Service is a simple, lightweight service for job management operation at the Computing Element (CE) level. CREAM accepts job submission requests (which are described with the same JDL language used to describe the jobs submitted to the Workload Management System) and other job management requests (e.g. job cancellation, job monitoring, etc). CREAM can be used by the Workload Management System (WMS), via the ICE service, or by a generic client, e.g. an end-user willing to directly submit jobs to a CREAM CE. For the latter user case a command line interface (CLI) is available.

products.name: emi.python-daemon
products.description: introducing the python-daemon missing from EPEL
products.releaseNotes: introducing the python-reportlab missing from EPEL
products.changeLog: introducing the python-reportlab  missing from EPEL

products.name: gfal2.gfal2
products.description: GFAL (Grid File Access Library ) is a C library providing an abstraction layer of the grid storage system complexity.

products.name: glexec.glexec
products.description: gLExec is a program that acts as a light-weight (gatekeeper). gLExec takes Grid credentials as input. gLExec takes the local site policy into account to authenticate and authorize the credentials. gLExec will switch to a new execution sandbox and execute the given command as the switched identity. gLExec is also capable of functioning as a light-weight control point which offers a binary yes/no result called the logging-only mode.

products.name: infn.storm
products.description: StoRM provides a flexible, configurable, scalable and high performance SRM solution. It supports standard Grid access protocols as well as direct access (native POSIX I/O call) on data, fostering the integration of non Grid aware application providing local access on shared storage. Another important characteristic of StoRM is the capability to identify the physical location of a requested data without querying any database service but evaluating a configuration file, an XML schema that describes the storage namespace and input parameters as the logical identifier and SRM attributes. StoRM relies on the underlying file system structure to identify the physical data position.
products.changeLog:
This release provides STORM v. 1.11.5, v. 1.11.6, v. 1.11.7 v.11.8 containing:
 StoRM Backend v. 1.11.8, v. 1.11.7 and v. 1.11.6, v. 1.11.5 
 StoRM Frontend v. 1.8.8, v. 1.8.7 and v. 1.8.6
 YAIM StoRM v. 4.3.7 and v. 4.3.6
StoRM Dynamic Info Provider v. 1.7.7
StoRM Native Libs v. 1.0.3
StoRM GridHTTPs Server v. 3.0.2
and the first release of the StoRM WebDAV service: StoRM WebDAV v. 1.0.26, supported only on SL/CENTOS6, which replaces the storm-gridhttps server.
